alert.note: Alert for Frederick (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 28 at 7:01PM EDT until July 28 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND...HOWARD AND CENTRAL MONTGOMERY COUNTIES IN CENTRAL MARYLAND...EAST CENTRAL FREDERICK COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND AND WEST CENTRAL BALTIMORE COUNTIES IN NORTHERN MARYLAND... At 701 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Sykesville, or 12 miles northwest of Historic Ellicott City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management has reported numerous instance of wind damage in Montgomery County. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Germantown, Rockville, Gaithersburg, Olney, Damascus, Historic Ellicott City, Ellicott City, Aspen Hill, Potomac, North Bethesda, Woodlawn, Randallstown, Montgomery Village, Eldersburg, Milford Mill, North Potomac, Redland, Mount Airy and Sykesville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
